DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether acceptance-based behavior therapy for GAD results in greater symptom reduction and increased quality of life than applied relaxation.
DOC.brief_title: RCT of an Acceptance-based Behavior Therapy for GAD
DOC.criteria: principal diagnosis of GAD at least moderate (4 on a scale from 0 to 8) on the ADIS Severity Scale for GAD symptoms willing to maintain current psychotropic medication levels (and have been stabilized on any current medications for at least three months) and refrain from other psychosocial treatments for anxiety or mood problems during the course of therapy fluent in English 18 years or older bipolar disorder psychotic disorders substance dependence active suicidal intent if anxious symptomatology is due to a medical/physical condition
